title: 'Merry Christmas to all': US releases footage of strikes against ISIS in Nigeria - watch
description: The US Department of War released footage of strikes against ISIS terrorists in northeast Nigeria, following President Trump's announcement of "powerful and deadly strikes." These precision attacks, carried out at Trump's direction, targeted militants he accused of "viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians."

title: NFL’s cryptic Stranger Things crossover post leaves fans amused and confused
description: The NFL sparked online speculation with a cryptic video featuring individuals in pink, reminiscent of Netflix's Stranger Things. This eerie, context-free post, captioned with a question about concern, leveraged internet humor and ambiguity to drive engagement. The league's subtle approach blurred marketing and pop culture, effectively reaching younger audiences by participating in broader entertainment conversations.

description: Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' shows no signs of slowing down, smashing records in its third week at the box office. The festive Christmas period added a remarkable boost, with the film netting THIS amount on its 21st day. Despite facing competition from new releases, 'Dhurandhar' has raked in an impressive Rs 633 in total in India.

title: Aquarius Horoscope Today, 26 December 2025: Ganesha says you’ll treat money matters with seriousness and structure
Gurgaon shooting: Woman refuses marriage proposal, 2 open fire at her; arrested
description: A disturbing episode occurred near a workplace in Gurgaon, where a woman was shot by a man she had previously rebuffed. The police swiftly acted, arresting two suspects, Tushar and Shubham, in Uttar Pradesh. Tushar reportedly confessed that his violent outburst stemmed from his inability to accept her refusal, marking a troubling escalation of previous unwanted advances.

title: ‘You have not even scratched the surface’: Mahesh Bhatt recalls advising Alia to learn from Meryl Streep, shares thoughts on her career and parenting
MLB trade rumors: Yankees tipped to re-sign $80M ex-Cubs star
description: The New York Yankees are prioritizing re-signing Cody Bellinger, viewing him as a crucial long-term outfield piece alongside Aaron Judge and Trent Grisham. After a successful 2025 season, the team believes Bellinger's blend of power, defense, and versatility is irreplaceable.  Despite interest from other clubs, the Yankees are emphasizing continuity and a familiar environment for the 30-year-old free agent.

title: Just five DNA letters flip chromatin from fluid to solid-like state
description: New research has found that the way the genome is organised can arise from chromatin’s own physics, without needing extra instructions; by slightly changing nucleosome spacing, researchers were able to flip chromatin between an open, tough state and a  fluid state

title: Gujarat Deputy Speaker resigns, cites ‘other responsibilities’
After leaders discuss ‘bias against Brahmins’ at meet, UP BJP warns MLAs against caste-based activities

Goschen Library in Chintadripet getsa makeover, to be opened in January
description: Restored at a cost of ₹2.36 crore, the 100-year-old library has over 18,000 books, dedicated reading spaces, computers, and refurbished toilets; students can use the facility to prepare for competitive examinations, and space has also been provided for holding interactive sessions

title: Centre ‘upset’ over poor response to Pariksha Pe Charcha in Maharashtra
MoEF told Survey of India to map Aravali hills by 100m rule
description: The government has directed the Survey of India to map the Aravalis using a new 100-meter height definition, sparking widespread protests. Environmentalists fear this shift to a height-based marker will significantly shrink the recognized ranges, potentially undermining conservation efforts for the predominantly low-lying Aravalis. The ministry maintains mining controls remain intact.

title: School teacher shot dead on AMU campus, search on for killers
Who is Ganesh Uike? Top Maoist from Telangana with Rs 1.1 crore bounty killed in Odisha
description: Maoist commander Ganesh Uike, also known as Paka Hanumanthu and carrying a Rs 1.1 crore bounty, was killed in a security operation in Odisha's Kandhamal district. A central committee member and Odisha in-charge, he was linked to major operations like the 2013 Jhiram Ghati ambush. His death is considered a significant milestone in eliminating Naxalism.

title: Helium cylinder explosion: Balloon seller killed, 4 injured near Mysuru Palace
description: On Thursday night, the celebration at Mysuru Palace was shattered by the tragic explosion of a helium cylinder, resulting in one death and injuring four others, including visiting tourists. The sound of the blast carried a kilometer away, alarming the community as emergency crews rushed to the scene.

title: Goal to aspire for
Workers left out of Israel jobs flight take legal route: ‘Mortgaged land, jewellery’
GDP growth likely  to moderate with inflation nearing 4%: RBI panel member
‘Killing innocent Christians’: Trump orders US strikes on ISIS in Nigeria; signals more action
description: US President Donald Trump announced a "powerful and deadly strike" against ISIS terrorists in northwest Nigeria, citing their targeting and killing of Christians. He claimed the "Department of War" executed "perfect strikes" at his direction, vowing to prevent radical Islamic terrorism from prospering. Trump had previously warned of repercussions if the slaughter of Christians continued.

title: US launches ‘powerful strikes’ against Islamic State in Nigeria, says Donald Trump

Redevelopment of railway stations under ABSS project progressing fast
Record! 14-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi scripts history
description: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi made history by smashing 190 off 84 balls for Bihar against Arunachal Pradesh in the Vijay Hazare Trophy. He became the youngest to score a List A hundred and the first men’s cricketer to hit centuries in both List A and T20 cricket before 15. His knock helped Bihar post a record 574.

title: Fifty years: Chinese oil for U.S.: deal in the offing
PM Modi: Freed country from tendency to link all good works with one family
description: Prime Minister Modi, inaugurating a memorial in Lucknow, criticized past governments for glorifying a single family and neglecting national heroes. He stated the BJP government is rectifying this by honoring all contributors and dismantling barriers like Article 370. The memorial celebrates Jan Sangh stalwarts, emphasizing the BJP's commitment to merit-based recognition over dynastic politics.

title: No room for spin: Australia goes into the 4th Ashes with a pace-heavy attack against England
description: England lost each of the first three tests to allow Australia to retain the Ashes in just 11 days of on-field action

title: Madhavaram, Manali lakes to get boating facility by Pongal
description: TTDC has completed the feasibility study to introduce boating services, and has conducted trials to determine whether the waterbodies have enough depth to allow the operation of motorboats

title: Newspaper reading now a must for students in UP government schools
description: Uttar Pradesh schools will now make newspaper reading compulsory for students. A 10-minute slot during morning assembly will be dedicated to reading news, aiming to boost general knowledge, improve vocabulary, and foster critical thinking. This initiative seeks to reduce screen time and cultivate informed, empathetic citizens aware of local and global events.

title: Balaji is core member of team, can be considered for next tie: Rajpal
description: Rajpal explained that the choice was influenced by the need for a deuce-court specialist in the doubles pairing

title: Tightening the opium belt in Madhya Pradesh
description: The Madhya Pradesh High Court’s remark that a case against an 18-year-old man, arrested for illegal opium possession, was ‘rather suspicious’, led to the suspension of six police personnel. It also brought the focus back on Malwa region’s historic opium cultivation. Mehul Malpani reports on how farmers find themselves caught between drug smuggling and crackdowns by government agencies

title: New social media policy: Indian Army eases restrictions for soldiers
description: Indian Army eases social media restrictions for its soldiers, allowing limited access to platforms like Instagram for viewing and monitoring.  Skype, WhatsApp, Telegram, and Signal can be used for exchanging unclassified information with known contacts. YouTube, X, Quora, and LinkedIn also have specific, restricted uses, focusing on passive information gathering and professional networking, a significant shift from previous blanket bans.

title: Jeev wins in Colombo; Pukhraj claims IGPL Order of Merit, gets entry to International Series
description: As Jeev won his maiden IGPL title, Pukhraj Singh Gill, despite finishing T-12th, won the IGPL Order of Merit by a razor thin margin over Aman Raj and Gaganjeet Bhullar

title: Two persons held for stealing car at a petrol bunk in Chennai
Labelled Bangladeshi, youth lynched in Odisha, claim kin; police cite monetary dispute
description: A 20-year-old Bengali mason, working in Odisha for the first time, was tragically beaten to death by a mob. While his family claims he was falsely accused of being Bangladeshi, police state the violence erupted from a monetary dispute. Two other migrant workers were critically injured in the attack.

title: Chelsea boosted by return of Delap and Estevao ahead of Villa test
description: Chelsea is fourth in the league, trailing third-placed Villa by seven points

title: Colonel assault case: CBI drops murder bid charge; SIT accused of 'shielding' policemen
description: CBI has filed a chargesheet against four Punjab Police personnel, naming Inspector Ronnie Singh as the prime accused in the assault on Colonel Pushpinder Bath. Charges of attempted murder were dropped, replaced with 'causing grievous hurt' and 'wrongful restraint' following a parking dispute.

title: Viral video shows Clavicular and N3on attacked as Kick ban controversy grows
description: A viral video shows Braden “Clavicular” and N3on being splashed with a red liquid by a man many online users link to a past livestream crash. Social media reactions remain divided. An Adin Ross associate confirmed the man survived. Clavicular has stayed silent, and his Kick channel status remains unclear.

title: More than medicine: How a weight-loss drug helped US envoy free prisoners in Belarus
description: A casual chat about weight loss between a US envoy and Belarus's leader, Alexander Lukashenko, unexpectedly paved the way for releasing over 120 political prisoners.  The personal exchange, involving a prescription drug, helped break the ice for crucial negotiations on sanctions relief and prisoner swaps, ultimately reuniting families and easing US restrictions on key Belarusian exports.

title: IIT-Kanpur survey to assess extent of sand mining was illegal, says T.N. govt.
description: ED had tasked the institute to assess the quantum of sand mined at 28 permitted sites during October-November 2023

title: In MP, a highway learns to slow down for tigers
description: India's first wildlife-safe road corridor debuts on Bhopal-Jabalpur highway. A 12km stretch through a tiger reserve features speed-calming red markings, fencing, and 25 underpasses. This integrated approach aims to drastically reduce animal road deaths by guiding wildlife and slowing vehicles in critical tiger habitats.

title: Daily Horoscope for 26 December 2025: Astrological Forecasts for Libra, Leo, Pisces, Aries, Sagittarius, and All Zodiac Signs
This winter, Christmas festivities lift spirit of moribund Kashmir tourism
description: According to local hoteliers, occupancy of most hotels jumped from around 20% to around 70% on eve of Christmas

title: Circulatory system diseases remain leading cause of deaths in 2023: Report
description: Annual report on medical certification of cause of deaths showed circulatory system disease was the leading cause of death in medically certified deaths across all age groups starting from 15 years of age

title: Odisha: Maoist commander Ganesh, 3 others killed in encounter
description: Naxal carried a Rs 1.1 crore bounty on his head

title: Fire & cold: Karnataka crash survivors recall ordeal as ambulances arrive late
description: Passengers escaped a bus fire near Hiriyur after a collision, facing a long, cold wait for medical aid. Despite quick firefighter response, ambulances were delayed by heavy traffic, leaving injured survivors to rely on locals for initial help and transport to hospitals.

title: Around 55km from Chandigarh, Sikh woman donates land for mosque; Hindus give money
description: In a heartwarming display of unity, a 75-year-old Sikh woman in Punjab's Jakhwali village donated land for a new mosque. Sikh and Hindu families are also contributing financially to the construction. This gesture highlights the village's long-standing tradition of interfaith harmony, where all communities support each other's religious needs.

title: Navi Mumbai airport takes off with 48 flights, 4k passengers
description: Navi Mumbai International Airport officially opened its doors with the arrival of IndiGo flight 6E460 from Bengaluru. The new gateway handled 48 flights and over 4,000 passengers on its first day, significantly easing Mumbai's air traffic congestion. Despite initial signage and road access challenges, the airport marks a major expansion for the region's connectivity.

title: ‘Say his name’: Laura Loomer on lynching of Hindu man in Bangladesh; attacks Islamic hatred
description: A Hindu factory worker, Dipu Chandra Das, was lynched in Bangladesh following unverified blasphemy accusations. Right-wing activist Laura Loomer highlighted the incident, warning of spreading Islamist hatred and urging international attention. The killing has reignited concerns for religious minorities in Bangladesh, with critics questioning the current leadership's response to such attacks.

title: JNUTA demands reinstatement of Jamia professor suspended over question on atrocities against Muslims

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi attended a Christmas service, emphasizing love and compassion, as the BJP intensifies its outreach to the Christian community. Party president JP Nadda also participated in regional celebrations. This engagement follows previous outreach efforts, though opposition highlights concerns over incidents targeting Christians in some areas.

title: Is Luka Doncic playing tonight vs Rockets? Latest Lakers injury update
description: Luka Doncic's status for the Lakers' Christmas game against the Rockets remains uncertain, listed as questionable with a lower left leg contusion. He missed the recent loss to Phoenix after sustaining the injury on December 20.  His potential return significantly impacts the game's dynamics and betting lines, with a final decision expected close to tip-off.

title: Mob kills minority Hindu man, interim government blames ‘terror’ activities by victim
description: The deceased, identified as Amrit Mondal, had allegedly formed a criminal gang and was involved in extortion and other criminal activities

title: Delhi high court bars dummy school from running classes XI and XII, admitting students
description: Delhi High Court has barred Richmondd Global School from admitting new students to classes XI and XII and initiated contempt proceedings against its management for violating a previous undertaking. The court ordered the school to deposit Rs 75 lakh, collected from students enrolled only on paper, and allowed 128 students to transfer to a nearby CBSE-affiliated school.

title: Mild tension at Gandhi Darshan amid dispute over managing committee
Will Travis Kelce play tonight? Retirement rumours swirl before Broncos clash
description: The Kansas City Chiefs' tight end, Travis Kelce, has sparked retirement rumors as the team recorded a pretty average performance this season. Amid this, many fans are stressing whether the team's popular tight end, Travis Kelce, will be taking the field at the Arrowhead Stadium tonight as the Chiefs gear up to face the Denver Broncos.

title: Consider Australia-like law to ban children under 16 from accessing social media: Madras HC
Vanessa Bryant tightens security amid new threat tied to Kobe Bryant’s legacy
description: Kobe Bryant and his teenage daughter, Vanessa Bryant, died in a tragic crash in 2020. Despite the tragedy, Vanessa Bryant has been able to rebuild her life along with their three daughters. Amid the mess, Kobe Bryant's wife, Vanessa Bryant, is now facing a tragic issue related to the NBA legend's legacy that he has left behind.

J&K: Authorities ban all VPNs for two months in Kathua; order cites security concerns
description: Authorities in Jammu's Kathua district have suspended VPN services for two months due to security concerns, following similar actions in Rajouri and Poonch. Citing misuse for bypassing cyber restrictions and accessing prohibited content, the order aims to prevent unlawful activities and protect sensitive data. The district magistrate's directive mandates strict enforcement, with violations facing legal consequences.

title: 'Work from Home' is officially dead, says CEO of the world’s largest recruitment company
description: Major tech and finance companies, including Amazon, Google, and JPMorgan, are mandating a full return to the office for employees in 2025. This shift signals an end to the remote work era, with flexibility now becoming a perk reserved for top performers possessing specialized skills.

description: December witnessed two significant developments — one involving Funskool, the Chennai-headquartered toy manufacturer, and the other emerging from the temple town of Madurai. description: Thousands of Indian truck drivers in California are suing the state after their commercial licenses were slated for cancellation due to federal audit findings on expiry dates. Drivers, many of whom are Punjabi Sikhs, argue the state's errors are punishing them and threatening their livelihoods and families. Advocacy groups warn of increased profiling and wider economic disruption.

The developments come amid continued mob killings, political unrest and heightened concerns over minority safety and law and order ahead of the February 17 general elections.

description: Barwan Kalan, a remote Bihar village, is dubbed the "hamlet of bachelors" as lack of roads, water, and electricity has prevented marriages for over 50 years. Despite being near tourist spots, residents face isolation, with basic services like hospitals and schools miles away.

title: Nancy Kerrigan net worth: How the skating legend built wealth beyond ice
description: Nancy Kerrigan, a two-time Olympic medalist and former U.S. Champion, is celebrated for her resilience.  Following a shocking attack before the 1994 Olympics, she made a remarkable comeback, winning a silver medal.  Her post-competitive career includes ice shows, TV appearances, and endorsements, contributing to an estimated net worth of $10 million.

title: iRobot Bankruptcy: Co-founder explains reason; blames Chinese rivals, Amazon deal block
description: iRobot, famed for its Roomba vacuums, has filed for bankruptcy, with former CEO Colin Angle citing fierce competition from Chinese firms. He highlighted how these rivals leveraged China's domestic market and government support, creating an uneven playing field.  The failed Amazon acquisition further complicated iRobot's struggles, ultimately impacting the broader consumer robotics sector.

title: Nvidia may have just admitted that it cannot take Amazon, Google & Microsoft in Cloud
description: Nvidia has shelved its ambitious plan to directly challenge cloud giants like Amazon Web Services, Google Cloud, and Microsoft Azure. The chipmaker is now refocusing its DGX Cloud division inward, prioritizing its own engineers' AI model development. This strategic pivot aims to protect Nvidia's dominant AI chip market share, estimated at over 80%, rather than pursuing cloud revenue.

title: Christen Goff says motherhood inspired a makeover of the family homes
description: Christen Goff is navigating motherhood by creating two distinct yet personal homes in Los Angeles and Michigan for her and daughter Romy.  She thoughtfully designs each space to reflect its location and their evolving family identity.  Despite the challenges of a newborn and dual residences, Christen finds joy and belonging in this new chapter.
